extendedIngredients.name: bacon rashers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 rashers smoked streaky bacon or about 175g ham, chopped into pieces

extendedIngredients.name: cheddar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 50g strong cheddar, grated, plus extra for sprinkling, if you like

recipes.title: Quiche Lorraine frittata

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling Wine are my top picks for Frittata. Even if you aren't making mimosas, sparkling wine is great with eggs for two reasons. One, if you're eating eggs early in the day, sparkling wine has less alcohol. Secondly, it cleanses the palate, which is important since yolk is known to coat the palate. One wine you could try is Perrier-Jouet Nuit Blanche. It has 4.9 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 68 dollars.

productMatches.title: Perrier-Jouet Nuit Blanche
productMatches.description: The sweeter taste, combined with the rounded and smooth mouth feel give the wine, a full body and richness that makes Perrier-Jouët Nuit Blanche the perfect champagne to awaken the senses.Perrier-Jouët Nuit Blanche is an exceptional Non-Vintage blend of 20% Chardonnay, 40% Pinot Noir and 40% Pinot Meunier, sweetened to taste with a 20g/l dosage of cane sugar to create a sensual style.

recipes.instructions: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4.If you’re using bacon, put it into a largefrying pan and cook over a gentle-mediumheat. Stir occasionally untilgolden and beginning to crisp up.Line a roasting tin, about 20 x 28cm,with baking parchment – just scrunch itroughly at the corners. Whisk togetherthe eggs and milk in a large jug or bowl,then stir in the bacon or ham, plus anyfat from the pan, the cheddar and someseasoning. Pour into the tin, scatter witha bit of extra grated cheese, if you like,and bake for 30-35 mins until golden andset. Carry to your picnic in its tin and eathot, warm or cold, with bread, cherrytomatoes and a few salad leaves.

steps.step: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4.If you’re using bacon, put it into a largefrying pan and cook over a gentle-mediumheat. Stir occasionally untilgolden and beginning to crisp up.Line a roasting tin, about 20 x 28cm,with baking parchment – just scrunch itroughly at the corners.
Whisk togetherthe eggs and milk in a large jug or bowl,then stir in the bacon or ham, plus anyfat from the pan, the cheddar and someseasoning.

Pour into the tin, scatter witha bit of extra grated cheese, if you like,and bake for 30-35 mins until golden andset. Carry to your picnic in its tin and eathot, warm or cold, with bread, cherrytomatoes and a few salad leaves.
